review_body: 10th floor suite smoking room. Clean room, pool, hotel and courteous service. No frills such as room service, restaurant, bar, snack/convenience store, but the room has everything you need. Walking distance from beach, shopping and night life. If you’re wanting to explore and experience Oahu versus a hotel, this is the place to stay.

This place is fabulous. It's 6 minutes from the beach, and steps away from the heart of Waikiki. Our room was spacious with a balcony overlooking Waikiki and the Pacific. There is free parking and, best of all, this is about the friendliest and most helpful hotel staff I've seen anywhere. And the price is very reasonable. Other hotels charge a "facilities fee" and up to $50 a day for parking--money better spent on a nice meal or some fun activity. This place is low-key and not very showy, but delivers where it counts--in value and service.

We recently stayed at Ilima Hotel for eight nights. It was perfect match for us. It is not a fancy new hotel , however, price is very reasonable, location is great, five minutes walk to Duke Waikiki and all the shops, room is clean and well maintained, full kitchen, and free parking! I think it’s one of few if any hotels in that area which offers free parking . It works on first come first serve basis, however we never had a problem to find a spot. We enjoyed pool and sauna after long day around the island. Hotel personnel was very nice and friendly. We had cleaning service daily, and they did a good job, although we are not that messy. The only thing, that we were not able to get , is a higher floor with better view. But it was’t available for studio room that we booked. Not a big deal anyway, we spend mostly of the time out.I would definitely recommend it !

Two blocks off the strip, next to the canal. More quiet than the beach or on Kuhio. Traffic in Waikiki is quite loudSome find the rooms tacky, or outdated or funky. We loved it. $120 per night in Waikiki for a really large room ith full kitchen (fridge, stove, sink, dished, cutlery. A great view up into the mountains overlooking the canal. Small pool and private parking. Best of all the staff. Without going into the long story, Jay, the asst mgr. is THE BEST

We chose this hotel because it was one of the very few hotels with free parking. Parking is first come first served and could possibly be very busy at peak times - although we had no problem and managed a space each day.Only 10 minute walk from shops, restaurants and beach.Our studio was spacious, comfortable with a fully fitted kitchen and a balcony.very friendly welcoming staff. Excellent value for money - although we think we got the best value by booking directly online with the hotel. Even the response to the booking was very friendly and welcoming - a good start!Would definitely return to the Ilima.

Don't be put off by the fact that this is an older hotel. It's got so many advantages. It's off the beaten path - but only one block off the main drag - so it's quiet, but provides access to everything.The room is spacious, and has a full-size bathtub and a full kitchen.When I say kitchen, I mean everything. Full size refrigerator, microwave oven, coffee machine, stove, toaster, dishes, utensils, pots and pans, and even a dish-drainer, sponge, kitchen towels, and dishwashing detergent.There is a laundry room with several sets of washers and dryers only $3.50 each). The front desk can provide quarters, laundry detergent for $1 - and free hangers. Just ask. The folks at the hotel are welcoming and helpful. They have activities, like how to make your own kukui nut lei, and other cozy activities. There is a pool, a gym, and how many hotels actually provide FREE parking to the guests.There is no restaurant - so no room service.But you can get food and/or grocery delivery (just like at home) from DoorDash or GrubHub, or...)In fact, we did order and the delivery man brought the food to our door.We made the mistake of moving to the Outrigger Beach Resort, wanting to be on the beach and to have a restaurant in-house with room service.It was TOTALLY not worth the extra cost. In fact, the room service was sub-par. From the Illima, you are 2-3 blocks from the beach, one block from some really good restaurants, and one block from inexpensive city buses. The price is terrific.

Ilima Hotel has the friendliest staff! The room was spacious and clean. Beds were comfortable. Water pressure was good with lots of hot water. The hotel offers free ukulele lessons on Fridays along with singing by the staff in lobby and on Wednesdays there is a free Lei making class. We were not able to do the ukulele lessons but enjoyed the Ilima Ohana Chorus singing in the lobby and LOVED the Lei making class. The hotel is within walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping, Jump on the city bus, trolley or uber to get locations all over the island. There is a car rental place directly across the street from the hotel. If I return to Oahu I will absolutely stay here again!

We stayed for 7 nights at the Ilima. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is walking distance to the many shops and beach of Waikiki. Parking is free at the on site garage. The room was clean, and the beds seemed new and were comfortable. We loved our stay and look forward to our next stay at the Ilima!

We loved our two night stay at the Ilima Hotel. Our spacious room had two double beds and a full kitchen. Our seventh floor balcony had lovely views of the Ala wai canal and beyond. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and the staff was the best. Free parking was a bonus! I would definitely stay here again.

Customer service was great. They were so polite and answered any questions I had. The kitchenette is well supplied. Thank You for everything! It is rediculous to force more waord than necessary. Blah blah

We only stayed 1 night as stop over to Seattle but what a great hotel. Room was very clean, great size and with a balcony. Parking was included which makes a big difference to the standard US$25 most others charge. Hotel was really good value and will definitely book again on our next longer trip.

We stay at Ilima every time we come to Hawaii! Fab location and clean and tidy quiet rooms. Has everything we need. Best of all the staff are AMAZING! Love how I always have the pool all to myself. Fab location

Chosed Ilima hotel due to the relatively close location to Waikiki beach.Service was excellent and we had a good time during our stay. Although the furniture was a bit old, overall we had a good experience. Also free parking was a big plus.

It is a large building that offers very large studios, It has for ADVANTAGE to be perfectly located in the heart of the Waikiki,All transport in Waikiki is to made on foot with many shops and restaurants around. The rear part of the hotel overlooks the Ala Wai Canal and its large golf course. The view is beautiful !ILIMA offers a complementary car park but owing to heavy traffic & efficient public transports on the island (a bus stop is near the hotel), we do not recommend to rent a car.DISADVANTAGEIt is an old hotel built in the 1950s. The decoration of the common areas is no longer up to date and the condos facilities are aging and need be modernized, During our stay at the end of April 2019 work of renovation (balcony floor paints were in progress),Futhermore, our studio located on the 16th and last floor had the head of the bed which leaned on a pane with fins concealed by a curtain! It was very dangerous ! See picture,The reception team, although friendly is not very responsive to customer requests,DESPITE ALL, this hotel, without being perfect, is a good value for your vacation in Waikiki. because the cost of living in Hawaii and especially the price of hotels is higher than those applied on the mainland,

Friend recommended this small hotel, and although we had a few glitches (pool closed, a/c not strong enough) I would recommend it for budget travelers or people who don't like crowds. We had a suite, with a king and queen, full kitchn, lanai, and FREE PARKING! I liked that you parked your car, went in a gate to the elevator and voila, arrived on your floor. We were on the 12th with a mauka view, and around 10 minute walk from the beach, (kuhiam, which is a section of Waikiki Beach) We would be out of Waikiki by the time you reached your car in a large hotel parking garage. Washers and dryers available, and there is a small pool, and 2 sundecks on the opposite side. (there was painting being done on the pool side of the building)Need groceries, drive to or uber to Don Quijote near the Ala Moana mall, best prices and very local shopping experience.Ilima is an aloha experience...staff know your name after a day, they changed us to a room with stronger a/c, and what I considered the better view. Check out the rates!!!!

if you need a place to call home base and not looking for a place on the beach...this maybe the place for you...its in between Kuhio Ave and the Ala Wai and it across of the International Market Place (IMP)...its very central and very close to pretty much everything in Waikiki but not paying $$$$...you can walk down the street and be at the IMP in less than 5 minutes...go thru IMP and be at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping CenterI really liked that it was very close to the middle of Waikiki...ok so we stayed in the 1 bed room suite and it was good size for Waikiki it had a full kitchen if you need that...its not the nicest hotel but it worked for us...what I Like about was you could go to your room from your car and not have to go thru the front desk area...we had a king size bed in the bed room and a queen size sofa sleeper...it looks like it could use a renovation but its like a family type hotel not a resort...what I didn't like was the shower pressure but its like that for most hotels now with those low flow shower heads and where the toilet paper was... unless you can wrap you arms behind you its pretty hard to get it...we had to pull it off the dispenser and leave it on the bathtub... I attached photos ...would I stay again...yes its much closer to where I want to be compared to where I normally stay closer to the Zoo end of Waikiki cutting walking time

This old girl definitely is a little tired & had we been staying longer than 1 night I may have asked to change rooms as there was lifting wallpaper & signs of moisture in walls and not sure were the few was? However after been greeted with a friendly no hassle check in (even though we were early) Its location was perfect just being a hop and skip from beach, shopping and eateries we quickly ignored her faults. Room is huge for spreading out, beds were comfy, air conditioning sounds like a semi coming through the wall so we chose not to use. Full functioning kitchen once again not in top notch but functional. I was alittle uneasy about feeling safe with local bar on street but by evening street was full of other travelers and rooms have double locks so this country hick slept well!

I stayed 2 hours at this property and checked out the moment I saw roach bait under the sink and behind the microwave (see pics). Sure it's an island but I'm not paying almost $200 per night for a hotel with roach issues considering the room was on the 10th floor. I could understand if it was a motel but not at these prices. The rooms need definite makeovers. It gets 1 star for view however couldn't go on the lanai because they've got construction and painting going on so they handed me a sign at check-in to avoid it from 8 am - 5 pm. I've got a phobia of roaches so there was no way I could sleep here. I checked out within 2 hours and went back to Hampton Inn Suites in Kapolei.

It was our first time in Hawaii. We were meeting friends for a cruise. I was not too crazy about the destination because I dont really like "beach" places. I prefer Europe. I had no idea, even after reading reviews after reviews, what type of accomodation we would find. I was very pleasently surprised. We were there 3 days before the cruise and 3 days after. The building is and older property but it is located right in Waikiki close to everything. For those who know the place it is right the next street from Seaside, between Kuhio and Ala Wai. Many shop and restaurants in the area.The hotel staff greeted us extremely well after that awful loooong flight and we learned that we would be on the 6th floor (606). I was afraid about the noise due to the proximity to the main streets, it wasnt too bad with the AC on. The room (efficiency) was really big. The kitchen area is well placed and the bathroom is the old style of bathroom with bath and shower together but it is very practical. There are minimal dishes, cutlery, pot, pan,stove, fridge, toaster and a small coffee maker. All was clean and in working order. The only minus I could see is that the fan in the bathroom is extremely noisy and it works with the light switch, so no way to leave it off. The other minus is that the Air Conditionning is of the old window type and although it work well, it is also very noisy. The hotel parking in an Inside parking, it is free and is first come-first serve basis. We never had a problem. I dont know how many suites they have but considering the amount of parking spaces, I see it as excellent. The staff is very friendly, helpful and makes sure that you are satisfied. The hotel offers some classes of different things, like lei making classes, hula classes.Unfortunately, we were not there on a Tuesday when the Lei making classes take place. When I told the reception agent, she told me that since we were back after the cruise, she would make us one, and, we got them. That is special!After the cruise we were assigned room 506, so , just below the one we had on our 3 first days. Exactly the same set up.I would definitely recommend this place.It is excellent value for money. Our friends stayed in another hotel, close by, which was supposed to be upscale but they had less than half the size of what we had and not as many facilities for much more than what we payed.Should I ever go back to Honolulu, they would definitely be my first choice.

Stayed at the Ilima for 9 nights. Really good location. Apartment had a full kitchen and a great balcony to relax on. Apartment building is old and a little outdated, but it really suited us. It is a couple of blocks from the beach, but I very easy walk. Dukes lane is at the end of the street, and the ABC store and International Marketplace is just down the street too. Hotel staff are very lovely. I would not hesitate to stay here again next time

There's a lot to love about this hotel. The location is great. It's not too close to the beach where you have to deal with the noise. But it's close enough to the beach to walk. The hotel is also just a block from Duke's Lane Market and Eatery which is a nice place to grab some breakfast and coffee in the morning and bottled drinks in the evenings. The hotel also has a small kitchen in each room where you can cook small meals rather than go out to eat every meal which costs money. The employees of the hotel are just lovely! They are always friendly and try to be accommodating. Their communal computer was down and I needed to print a ticket for Peal Harbor that was in my email. They were nice enough to print it for me. They also had a free nut lei making class one morning. The ladies who taught that class were just delightful! They were a lot of fun. They even took a picture of me and my sister and my husband wearing our leis.Here's the but... parking is an issue and I'm not quite sure what the hotel can do about it. The parking stalls are far too narrow. Just about everyone parks over the line which will sometimes garner phone calls from the staff asking you to repark because you're over the line. When we were there, they were painting the parking garage. So, we had to move our vehicles constantly and because of the paining a handful of parking spaces were unavailable. There is a small lot across the street but it's not cheap. My advice... get a small rental car. They are easier to park between the lines.I am willing to stay there again because the positives at the hotel far outway the negative of the parking situation. But I will be getting a smaller rental car just to save myself the headache.

I love this hotel. The location is perfect, in central Waikiki, an easy walk to everything. It is near the beautiful Ala Wai Canal with the gorgeous mountains in the background. The second reason I love this hotel is the staff. They make this place great. Every time I see one of the staff members, there is a big, friendly, authentic smile. The vibe is very positive at this hotel and feels more local compared with the huge, impersonal hotel chains. This is an older hotel that is nicely kept. The staff takes pride in their work and in this hotel. Plus, the cost is reasonable for the great Waikiki location and the mini-apartment kitchen amenities that help save on dining out costs. I've stayed here several times before and will do so during future Waikiki trips!

My wife and I were staying in Waikiki in March and stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions. We have stayed here a few times previously. Basically, this hotel is excellent. It is well situated in a very handy location, rooms are clean and spacious, beds very comfortable and the complex has a nice pool, sauna and gym. Staff cannot do enough for you and are dedicated to making sure you have a great stay. We had a slight hiccup on our departure where our flight was delayed 16 hours and the hotel was great in helping us out and letting us stay longer. Highly recommend staying here.

Our apartment had plenty of space and functional appliances, but this property is in need of a renovation. The pictures of the rooms on the hotel’s website look much nicer than it actually is. There were some water stains on the ceiling and peeling paint in our room. Overall the room had an outdated and dingy feel even though the space was clean. Air conditioner was loud and the parking spaces were awkward to navigate. However, the cost is lower than other properties with similar amenities and the location is walking distance to almost everything you’ll need while on vacation. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Our room was big. Kitchen was old but functional. Air conditioning a bit loud. Free parking stalls are small and sometimes not enough; bring a compact car. Better yet, no car. Five-minute walk to endless food, shopping; ten minutes to beach. Self-serve laundry, with a laundry basket. Two suitcase foldouts. They have what we needed. We ate on the veranda. Views from our room were buildings and rooftops and such. Some rooms might have better views.

First it's a hotel with big apartments and that'is good for families. To bad that the rooms needs to be renovated. Kitchen was really bad in our room. The staff is super frendly. Parking is included but it is full sometimes. 2 nice rooftop sundeck. The area is not so good, right outside it was a drugdealer selling drugs.

As always images provided by management look much nicer than actuality! Also, remember that hotel accommodation in the area is expensive even for 3-star level hotels. However, I do recommend Ilima for several reasons once I got past the initial disappointment of the slightly used appearance that is understandable due to its age. The staff are very friendly and helpful – check in was easy and although we arrived early the room was ready for us as we got an upgrade. The one bedroom apartment was roomy, clean and comfortable with plenty of storage and full kitchen if we wanted to cook. Free parking is included although it can sometimes get full if you get in a little late; we got back around 9 pm one night and had to find alternative parking. The staff were helpful but we still had to pay $30 to park elsewhere. Location to the main shopping and eating area in Waikiki just a short walk away, two blocks from the main beach. The pool is quite small, and the gym could not really be called that with very little room or equipment. We enjoyed our week stay at Ilima and fully recommend it to other travellers.

I booked this hotel after reading positive hotel reviews. My stay was good accordingly. We were out most of the day coming back at night for the week we stayed. The room was cleaned well. The kitchen had everything you'd need for cooking. It's a short walk to all of waikiki attractions. Great location. Free parking is definitely plus. It's not a fancy place by any stretch of imagination but is clean and quiet. Front desk is kind and helpful.

King suite very comfortable and clean, kitchen has a full-size refrigerator and a full stove with oven. Good location with numerous restaurants nearby as well as grocery store with lots of prepared food. Nice pool on the grounds, parking garage, friendly staff. Older hotel but well maintained, and who needs to pay two-three times the price for new sparkle! Fantastic view from the 15th floor. Suite has a lanai.

Our one-bedroom king unit was well-maintained and comfortable for a week's stay. Free parking is a nice perk. WiFi worked very well. The kitchen was adequately stocked so we could eat breakfasts and many dinners in our unit. The Food Pantry is an easy walk; with a car, Times Supermarket and Kahala's Whole Foods are great options. We have stayed at the 'Ilima at least five times because we like having a kitchen, the prices are reasonable for a clean Waikiki lodging, and the location is close to everything yet away from the touristy beach. You do get city noises here, so the A/C fan was a helpful mask at night.

Very clean older hotel a short walk from the International Market Place and Waikiki Beach. The kitchenette room was comfortable and spacious and the staff were very nice. One of the closest hotels to the famous Marukame Udon noodle house.

A great place / base for an extended stay.A little dated, but clean, quiet, spacious. Kitchenette great, can't eat out all the time, saves. Free parking. Gets full, but they try and find a way to get everyone in.Club fee can be annoying but common among other hotels.Great WIFI.Friendly and amazing staff, adds to the aloha experience.Typically get a high level 1 bedroom, not ocean front, but view of both ocean and mountains. Coffee in the morning on the balcony, complimentary paper, ahhh, take me back.

Our family of four stayed here for 2 weeks in a nice spacious 2 bedroom. We had lots of room and a full kitchen. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. They even had an umbrella for us to borrow on a rainy day. The pool is kind of small but did the job on those hot days. The lei making was a lot of fun and a great keepsake. We found out about the patio on the 10th floor by accident. Its a nice place to go for a nice view or suntanning. Also has a washer/dryer area. A couple of blocks to the main Street and beach.The hotel is a little out dated but still a great place to stay for an affordable price.Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Like other reviewers, I would say this is a reasonably priced functional hotel not too far from the ocean. Our room was clean, with comfortable beds and pillows! A big plus! The kitchen area was very sparsely equipped and we had to ask the front desk for salt and pepper and a baking tray. The bathroom was cramped but OK for 2 people. The whole place is tired. On the positive side, the front desk staff were cheerful and helpful.

The location of this hotel was perfect. It's only a few blocks from the beach and a block away from international market. The building is old and it shows, but the room was spacious and clean. Friendly staff as well.

If you are looking for a reasonably priced functional hotel and are not obsessed with an Ocean View this hotel should be considered.Hotel is within 2 blocks of the beach, shops and moreWe stayed in one bedroom apartment , which was clean and spacious.Staff at the Hotel are to be complemented on their efficient welcoming manner.Parking was available in the hotel for guests who need it

What attracted me to the Ilima is the fact that they are the only hotel or condo with free parking in Waikiki. There were plenty of spaces available during my six night stay. The hotel could use a good refurbishing of everything, but then the price of the rooms would probably go up significantly. We had a kitchenette in the one bedroom suite and the kitchenette was great to have. Lots of nearby restaurants and delis which work out great for leftover or carry-out. The front desk people were very friendly, courteous and helpful. If you are on a budget, this is a great place to stay in Waikiki

For the price we had no complaints about the stay at all. Pros:The room was spotless start to finish. Great customer service, friendly and easy to deal withParking was always available (but we had old person hours)location was excellentprovided beach towels were very convenientpool was mostly just me when I went to itcomfy bedspersonal preference - they won't change out the towels daily if you don't ask them to, as a personally trying to be environmentally friendly and who doesn't need a new bath towel every day this was nice.Cons:it is dated, there are a few scars etc to the room but nothing that affected the stay, it was only aesthetic. lacked electrical sockets if you have a lot of electronicsOther:we were on the 4th floor and you probably want a higher room facing the city/mountains. facing the ocean, well according to another person you get a sliver between buildings. Facing the mountains you actually get to see mountains.

This is an old style hotel, and is probably the most spacious in all of Waikiki. It's basically an apartment. We loved everything about the hotel from the decorations in the lobby with koa wood to the island style furniture in the suites. We watched fireworks from our balcony. They let us check in super early around and didn't charge us any more. The staff is really friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and the amenities nice too. We will definitely choose this place again when we return.

We are from Alaska and always booked Ilima Hotel whenever we visit Honolulu and do some shopping. The cleanliness and spacious room, FREE PARKING is a huge advantage, nice and friendly front desk staff as well and near Waikiki. We will definitely stay again.

The title says it all, loved the place, loved the staff, very helpful, friendly and smiling front office staff, very clean rooms and fresh linen and towels, so good job house keeping staff. Walking distance to local beaches, We were a family of 4 , we even walked to Ala Moana shopping center and the Magic Island. We used the local TheBus for our travels to other places like Pearl Harbour, Kailua beach, etc and the good news is that the bus stops are 3 min walk from the hotel. We had a good view from our room, not that we spent too much time in there as there was so much to do outside. But we always came back to a clean tidy room which was great after a long tiring day. Kitchen was adequate. And if you need anything just have to ask. Bathroom was a bit cramped up but honestly we were happy as it was adequate for our needs. Definitely going back here when we visit again.

Staff was soo good to us. Showed us rooms to choose from at 00.40 in the night. Excellent beds. Nice to explore Honolulu for some nights here. Kitchenette was handy. Balcony with city view. Recommended for sure

My husband and two teenage sons recently stayed at the Ilima Hotel for 5 nights, and are very pleased with the services and accommodations that this hotel has to offer. We booked our room (a standard kitchenette) 8 months prior to our stay. We chose this hotel because at the time it was the most affordable option with the highest ratings and best reviews. Having stayed there, I agree with previous reviewers that this hotel is very clean and inclusive of so many services for which other more expensive and luxurious hotels charge an extra fee or simply do not have (e.g. parking and kitchen). Yes, it is outdated, but again, very practical and remarkably clean. We took advantage of the kitchen to make breakfast and to-go lunch, which allowed us to save money. The hotel is located a couple of blocks away from the beach, so we walked all around Waikiki without any problems. The staff is also very welcoming and helpful. If we ever return, we would definitely stay there again.

We loved this hotel.It sits a little back from the beach, but it is near many cozy restraurants, souvenir shops etc. It is clean and friendly. We had come in Honolulu and stopped for an overnight but you could easily use it for a base for longer stays. You could even cook a meal or two as there is a full kitchen. We felt at home here with the friendly staff.

We stayed at the Ilima for 3 nights in September. We like clean and safe, and this fit the bill. The room had a separate bedroom and a sofabed in the living room. Both were very comfortable, and the linens were very nice. It was nice to be able to spread out a little in a living room rather than just a bedroom. There were many windows, so we skipped the AC and let the breezes through. Our big balcony had a view of both the canal/hillside and the ocean, as well as a sliver of Diamond Head. It was so nice to sit on the balcony and have a drink. As mentioned in many reviews, the hotel is older, but this was fine with us because it was immaculate and reasonably priced. The location was great - Kuhio Avenue was at the other end of the block, and there are many restaurants and stores along it. The beach was only 2 blocks away, and the entire downtown Waikiki is walkable. Take the time to walk along the canal on Ala Wai Blvd, and look back at the great view of Diamond Head crater. For some fabulous food and a good time with other people, walk to the food trucks (left out the door, left onto Kuhio, and 3 blocks to Ka'iulani Ave). It's delicious, cheap, and fun, especially at night when the lights are on. Try the Kalua Pork at the first truck on the right, and the Pork Patty about 4 trucks on the left. We also had amazing fish and vegetarian tacos from a truck about halfway down on the right. The staff at this hotel were among the friendliest we've encountered - a nice smile and Aloha every time they saw us. They gave us lots of good information about the area, food, and buses. They made us feel at home. I unexpectedly fell in love with Waikiki, and when I return I will stay at the Ilima Hotel again.

Older hotel just off the Ala Wai Canal on the back side of Waikiki three blocks from the beach. Here for business - hotel paid by employer. Not my first choice for the Hawaii experience. That said, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little older but clean and taken care of. Large room with a kitchen and full sized fridge. Very tiny pool. 1/2 block to amenities including restaurants and stores. Limited parking. Free, good strenght wifi. A few characters on the street but it was not an issue. Stayed here during the hurricane Lane approach.

My wife and I were in Waikiki in transit to the USA and stayed at this hotel. We have stayed at this hotel many times now. Location is excellent and is handy to everything. Staff are polite, courteous and could not do enough for us. However, if you are looking for a modern hotel, don't stay here as it still has that "old charm". But it is clean, comfortable and the rooms are very spacious with some having great views over the canal, golf course and southern mountains. Pool, sauna and gym are a bonus too, not to mention the free activities they offer as well.....Hawaiin bead making lessons, ukelali lessons and Friday morning Hawaiin songs session......great stuff. Highly recommend.

My family of 4 stayed at this hotel for a 6 day vacation(Aug 15th-Aug21). The hotel was older,but very clean and neat. Has a gym, laundry facilities, free parking(just make sure you get back at a decent hour to find a parking space) a smaller pool but did the job when my youngest daughter didn't want to go to the beach one day. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Bed is a little harder then we are used to. Had a small kitchen furnished with plates, cups, utensils. The view from our room on the 10th floor of the city was amazing. Short walk to Waikiki beach and all the shopping and restaurants. We had a king and double bedroom The only negative would be the shower head was leaking at the wall and they had tape on it. It sprayed everywhere. I though would highly recommend this hotel. You'll have a great experience as we did

great value hotel. great location central to everything within walking and few blocks to the beach. rooms are a bit dated but hotel and rooms very clean and spacious studio rooms. the full kitchen was great for making breakfast and not having to eat out each meal.staff is great- very friendly and accommodating.ask for room facing canal/mountain for great view.customers of bar near hotel on the side street can make you think the location may be a problem if walking home late with kids but was never an issue. if you're ok with a bit dated hotel, it's a great place to stay with parking included, but usually need to get your car parked by 6 pm to guarantee a spot. highly recommended!

This hotel is pretty old but it has everything you need. Most importantly it was clean. It had a kitchen to make a basic meal. Free parking which is unusual for Waikiki area and free internet. Pretty close to the shops and Waikiki beach too. A couple of negatives the air con was really loud as it's a pretty old unit and their wasn't many utensils in the kitchen. These were only minor things though. Overall I would recoen d this hotel if you want something clean and affordable but with no frills.

Derek W
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: First of all, the staff are polite, very friendly and very helpful.The hotel is few blocks away from Wakiki beach and walkable to most of the shopping area at Wakiki. The room I stayed is spacious and had a kitchen and big balcony. The room is properly equipped with things that tourists need. The hotel has a laundry and the charges were reasonable. The hotel offers free car parking lots. These are positive facts. The downside of the hotel is that the fixtures are aged. We saw stains on the wooden cabinet. The electric stove was historic and luckily 3/4 workable. The car park was full at 6pm that made me avoiding to have dinner outside Wakiki during my one week stay. The hotel also charged facility fee over the hotel room rates. The swimming pool is very small and good for kids only.Nonetheless, the hotel gave me a enjoyable stay. It is good for family staying for few days.

This is a great location and the staff were really helpful and friendly but the hotel is definitely showing its age. Rooms were spacious and clean but old. Please remove shower curtains ! Kitchen utensils were a bit limited but it was great to have a fridge and microwave and somewhere to sit. Beds were very comfortable.

I stayed in a studio for a couple of weeks before my family arrived. Now we’re staying in a 2 bedroom until our house is ready. The place is big enough that we could stay here indefinitely and not go stir-crazy.The “full kitchen” has saved us a lot of money on food, but it leaves something to be desired. The small single basin sink is barely adequate for washing dishes for a family of four. We’re using paper plates to cut down on dishes. It was fine when I was by myself. They provide plenty of dishes, but cookware is a bit sparse. The refrigerator and freezer are pretty big, almost full size. The mattresses and pillows aren’t great, but this isn’t the Royal Hawaiian, so I wasn’t expecting much. I did buy a pillow, since we’ll be here a while. There isn’t a lot of room to unpack your clothes, and it seems like there are extra blankets and pillows in every drawer. We just piled them up in a closet. The bathroom is fine. The water pressure won’t knock your socks off, but the towels are good and the water is hot. Parking is free, that’s pretty awesome in Waikiki. They issue every guest who has a car a parking pass, and it’s first come, first served. The garage doesn’t always fill up, and you’re virtually guaranteed to get a spot if you’re in before 8. There are washers and dryers on the third floor, $2.50 to wash and $2.50 to dry. The pool is small, but great for kids. It’s kind of stashed between tall buildings, so rarely in direct sunlight (that’s good). The water temperature is inconsistent. Sometimes it’s just slightly chilly, more often it’s icy. There are sun decks on the 10th floor and the penthouse floor. Those are locked at 8pm. One small annoyance is the street that the hotel is on. There are a lot of one way streets in Waikiki. Nohonani is not one. But you can’t make a left onto it from Kuhio Avenue, forcing you to circle the block. Getting out of Waikiki is easy, it’s half a block to Ala Wai BLVD, and then a straight shot out. Waikiki beach is a couple blocks west, and there’s a grocery store, lots of high end shopping, and tons of restaurants and bars within two blocks. If you plan to get real use out of the kitchen, though, I recommend buying your groceries at the Target on Ala Moana BLVD, it’s 8 minutes by car and half the cost. The staff is amazing. Housekeeping and maintenance are friendly and efficient, but the front of the house really takes hospitality to another level. They raise this hotel from three stars to four.

We were really happy with this hotel. We have two teenagers and they gave us a rollaway bed, which worked perfectly for our family. We were surprised at how spacious the room was. We had an excellent view of the canal and we were a short walk away from the beach and shopping. The staff were friendly and the room was very clean with comfy beds. I highly recommend this hotel!

Was at this hotel in the penthouse suite with 5 other dear friends to celebrate a milestone birthday. Great comfortable and roomy beds. Convenient to the bus and shops along with some great restaurants and many Starbucks.

Ilima Hotel is very old. The room was very outdated.Bathroom was small and hard to use. A bit far from Waikiki Beach front, so I had to take Taxi / Uber to go back and forth. Parking was extremely difficult.

I stayed there for 6 nights. A short walking distance from Waikiki beaches, close to everything you may need.Spacious room with kitchen, free parking and the staff was always very helpful. It was a great stay!

São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

review_body: The staff here has been so friendly and helpful it has made our stay really comfortable. As mentioned in other posts the location is convenient. Some reasonably priced food close by at multiple venues and only a couple of blocks to the Bus stop. Only one comment for constructive criticism. There is no password to get to their router and this is a concern for on internet security. Huge room, ac, big tv and full kitchen.

The Ilima was perfect for our five night stay in Waikiki. We had a balcony that faced the mountains and canal. Beautiful view of the golf course. The room had a full kitchen and a dining area. Lots of room with a King size and a double(maybe queen) bed. It was an easy walk to the beach, shopping and restaurants.I did a lot of research before booking and this hotel had positive reviews with good reason. The staff were friendly and helpful. The big name hotels had mixed reviews and were much more expensive. I would highly recommend the Ilima no matter the length of your stay. If I'm ever lucky enough to get back to Hawaii I'll definitely be staying here.

A little dated in the rooms but VERY comfortable. Enjoyed our stay. Rooms are typically small studio apartments very reasonable for Wakiki area. Just short walk to beaches and shopping areas. Cozy views of the city

Reasonably priced by Waikiki standards. $16 Roberts shuttle from airport. Public bus would have taken us there for $2.50, but not with checked bags. Friendly staff, very helpful with tips on buses, grocery stores, etc nearby; clean rooms, although a bit dated decor (and so much pink!) they were perfectly suitable for our two-night stay. Good location, walkable to beach and groceries. The kitchenette was a plus - we were able to buy a dinner salad, snacks and breakfast items at the nearby grocery and eat in. We forgot an item in the room when we moved on to other islands, and staff were very helpful in finding the item and mailing it to our home.

Our stay is always great. The fact that we have parking in the structure is a must. We commute to Oahu for business and pleasure. When we're out and about, we don't have to worry about parking, afraid we may have to walk a block to get to our room. If you have family, you have a full kitchen to cook.

I was pretty disappointed when we first walked into the hotel room on the 12th floor, after a long day of travel to get here. The kitchen was dirty with crumbs next to the baseboards and in between the fridge and the wall and when you see a bug trap next to the fridge, it makes you wonder what creature is in your hotel. Throughout our week stay, we never did see a bug. phew! The kitchen is in need of a DEEP cleaning for sure. My husband even found an old pop tart in the cabinet from who knows when. Very dated hotel. The rest of the hotel was clean, thank goodness.We chose this hotel because it had a car/hotel bundle which saved us money, the reviews were not that bad (no concerns of pesky bugs) and it had a kitchen. Having a kitchen let me tell you SAVES you some money from not having to eat out for each meal.This hotel serves it's purpose. Somewhere to sleep, shower and cook your meals. I would much rather save money and stay in a cheaper hotel. It's a few blocks walking distance to waikiki beach. Also has a nice little pool, which we didn't know about until we got there.I would definately stay here again to save money. For a "budget" hotel, not too bad.

We are at the end of our 10 day stay and couldn’t be happier with our choice. We stayed here 10 years ago and like it just as much this time. We are in the deluxe room on the higher floor facing the canal. The breezes are wonderful and we haven’t had to turn on the air conditioning at all. The view of the canal, golf course and mountains is super relaxed by. My husband has plenty of room to store his bike on the balcony and from here it is quick to get to Mount Tantulus for an exhilarating ride. The room is very large with one king and a double, so we can get alone time when we want. It’s spotlessly clean and the housekeeping staff ( thanks Savannah) are great. I especially like the Hawaiian feel here and how quiet it is in the lobby and by the pool. There are plenty of gray cafes and restaurants around as well as a Food Pantry if you want to eat in. The decor is a bit dated but fine and there aren’t high end bath products. For what you save though, you could go buy the best products out there. We will be back.

Great location for the shops and beach on a quiet street. The staff is exceptional and very friendly. They have great advice for things to do and see. Great value to top it all off. Rooms were comfortable.

We have stayed at this hotel a few times previously and are return guests, staying on this occasion for 3 nights in March. This hotel is basic and slightly outdated, but the rooms are huge, clean and comfortable. Some have lovely views over the canal and golf course. It is well situated just off Kuhio Street and is a handy walk to everything. You can even walk to Alamoana shopping centre. Staff are excellent and very helpful. Luggage storage is available if required and they have Hawaiian necklace making lessons on Wednesdays and Hawaiian song singing on Fridays....great fun. Highly recommend.

This moderately priced older hotel is just two blocks from Waikiki Beachfront and is well situated for restaurants, foodhalls, shops and supermarkets. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and would thoroughly recommend this property to anyone on a budget. It is spotlessly clean and tucked away on a quiet street.

Illima is one block from the main shopping and restaurant street of Waikiki, several blocks past more modern and expensive Hyatts, Sheratons, etc. to the main beach, and on one side fronted over the canal, golf course and distant mountains. My main criteria for hotels are clean, healthy, safe (and good wifi), all met easily here. If your tastes are for ultra crisp Hyatts and similar it won't do the job for you, but that wasn't a problem for us. It could probably do with a multimillion dollar refurbishment to replace older surfaces that have been repainted too many times, older furniture and carpets though they are still clean and comfortable. The front desk is very friendly and helpful,had some experience with the back office which was the same. There is a free internet, computer, printer set up in the lobby that I probably overused, and the room wifi is strong. Our two bed room was very large with a dining table and chairs, kind of older fashioned kitchen set up, stuffed chair and a lanai (pictured) which though caught a lot of wind and wasn't as usable as I would have liked. If you rent a car in HNL - which I recommend, driving is not difficult and the rolling refrigerators of the bus system could kill you if you're not used to Arctic exploration (see my review elsewhere) - the parking here is free, although when we arrived at 11PM we got the last space available and it was a real squeeze (there is available public pay parking across the street). That's a considerable saving over the other hotels. Basically $200 a night with taxes compared to sometimes twice that nearby. A great value, good folks, highly recommended.

By Waikiki standards this is reasonably priced hotel. The biggest advantage of the hotel is its location - reasonable walking distance to Waikiki beach. It also offers free parking and a kitchen in each room. It is maintained in a clean condition but offers very limited amenities. In addition to the nightly room rate, they charge a $20 daily "resort fee" that covers among other things a fitness facility the size of a small bedroom, with one stationery bicycle and one treadmill, and a swimming pool the size of a postage stamp. The kitchen is aging but functional. As the saying goes, "you get what you pay for." If you are looking simply for a clean place to lay your head at night, with good access to other attractions, this is a good hotel.

San Francisco Bay Area

review_body: This was the 3rd and 4th time we have stayed at the Ilima and once again it was a great experience. In Feb , we stayed there for 7 nights before our cruise and 2 nights after (really 1 night and an extra day).Our Deluxe studio gave us a great mountain view and was plenty big enough for 3 adults (one King and one Queen Bed). We had a full kitchen which we used mainly for breakfast and snacks. Everything worked just fine. There is ample storage space.The beds were comfortable. Extra pillows were promptly and cheerfully supplied when requested. Lots of towels. Towels are supplied for the beach and pool, as are beach mats. Free coffee for the coffee maker.Hotel - General comments: This is an older and smaller but well-kept hotel. It is located about 1/2 block from Kuhio (all the major bus routes run along Kuhio - so it is especially convenient if you plan to use local transit) and about a 10 minute walk from Waikiki beach. This is a very good hotel for budget minded people who don't mind not being at a big resort on the beach.Housekeeping deserves a special mention. The room was spotless when we arrived and was very well-cleaned every day.Facilities we used:The small laundromat is very convenient and we used it twice. The front desk will sell you quarters and laundry detergent.Free WiFi - we used this a lot!Pool - the pool is small but was quite adequate to cool off in.Front Desk Staff - always helpful. Plenty of tourist brochures around and they will give you a local (Waikiki) map.What impressed us the most: When we returned from our cruise for our short pre flight home stay, our room was ready for us even though it was only about 10AM (They normally don't guarantee rooms until the afternoon - so this was such a pleasant surprise!) Kudos to housekeeping for having the room ready! To me this is a perfect example of the thoughtful, personalized service you get at this hotel.

We really enjoyed staying at the Illima. It was in a great location near the beach, shops and places to eat. It was also near the bus stop, which made it easy to see other areas of Oahu. The hotel gives you a map with bus information on how to get to specific sites. It really beats driving in crowded Honolulu. Hotel itself was well cared for, and the full kitchen, large rooms, and lanai made for a nice stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would ask for a room overlooking the canal. Ours was city view, which was OK. Overall, the Illima is a good choice for Waikiki.

Four adult travellers . There was misunderstanding when we arrived, and the room had to be changed to a 1 bedroom with king size bed and a pull out bed in the lounge room for two adults. The room had a musty smell, the kitchen was equipped enough but very old. Pull out bed very uncomfortable, complained and got a convoluted underlay, not much better. The staff were excellent but I would not recommend this hotel if you want comfort.

Have stayed at this hotel twice this year & love it. Older hotel just off the main Waikiki strip. Room is spacious (we had 1 King & 1 Queen bed) and is very comfortable. Room has good size balcony, air conditioning, tv & a kitchen (small stove, microwave, coffee maker of course, dishes, cutlery and a full size fridge with freezer. Makes it great for having groceries or enjoying leftovers if you eat out. Free parking (3 levels including 2 wheelchair spots) & free wifi. There’s a small pool & I believe a little fitness centre (though we’ve never used it). Customer service is Exceptional! Every staff member is friendly & they are always willing to help. We brought my elderly Mom who doesn’t have good balance anymore and needs to sit in the shower. They helped us get a standard, medical stool that sits in the tub for just such a purpose. Hotel also has a small guest laundry on level P3 which was a nice bonus (front desk will sell you the quarters and laundry soap you need). Please understand, it’s not new or modern or fancy by a long stretch. If that’s what you want go somewhere else. This is an older, casual, comfortable, easy and very friendly hotel just 1 block from the strip that will take good care of you and make you feel at home. Highly recommend.

While it is 1960s or 1970s, from pink walls to blue wall-to-wall carpets, the hotel is very comfortable and we loved it. Great beds, quiet, efficient A/C, balcony, fridge and microwave, free parking (!), and a lot of space. The Murphy bed was even more comfortable and bigger than the queen-size bed in the bedroom. We loved the little details that are often missing at other condohotels such as bedside reading lamps, a clock, daily housekeeping, free and fast wifi. The hotel personnel was extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us more blankets, provided beach towels, and presented us with lei upon departure. The whole feel of our stay was like at home. And the location is great, easy short walk to all the restaurants and the beach, but on a quiet street. Thank you to Ilima for our nice vacation.

review_body: Although the building is old. The rooms are very clean and have all the needed amenities. Very great central location. The amazing staff at the front desk are probably why I would return! Very warm place!

This hotel was just what we wanted: conveniently located, yet away from the craziness of the main Waikiki strip. The room was large and the kitchen facilities helped us keep within our budget. The staff was friendly and cheerful, and we enjoyed the complimentary lei-making workshop. And the view from our 16-floor balcony, overlooking the canal, was a huge plus.

After having a bad experience at another hotel, the Ilima were fortunately able to accommodate us for our week-long stay in Waikiki. We stayed in a one-bedroom apartment, with all the amenities we could need (full kitchen, large lounge room, two TVs, in-room wifi, balcony with lovely canal views). The décor and furniture were dated, but everything was clean and in working order. The Ilima is in a great, central location – basically right behind the International Marketplace, and a block away from supermarket Food Pantry. Despite being amongst the hustle and bustle of the city, our room was quiet with the windows closed, and we didn’t hear noise from outside or other hotel guests.The hotel is excellent value for money. We learnt the hard way, from our first hotel, that you get what you pay for. The Ilima is not the cheapest hotel you’ll find, but it is still in the ‘budget’ range and is well worth the extra couple hundred bucks. All the staff were pleasant and greeted us on our way in/out of the hotel. Jay and Shawn were particularly helpful and friendly to us, which we very much appreciated. We had a great stay at the Ilima, with no problems. We would absolutely stay here again.

The rooms, the staff, the location, the VALUE, everything was just awesome! We had 2 studios right next to each, as requested. The rooms we spacious, clean. And very, very comfortable! The staff was helpful and friendly. The pool was wonderful. It doesn’t matter if it’s a shaded area, it’s a heated pool! We liked it better in the shade, just to get a break from the sun. And definitely go to the lei making class they offer, the instructors are so wonderful and it felt like a true Hawaiian experience! I would highly recommend this hotel!! Thank you for helping myself and my family experience true paradise Ilima!!

New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here 6 nights. Room on the tenth floor roomy and comfortable. Bed comfy and nice pillows. Bathroom a little small and dated but adequate for two. Full kitchen with hotplates and utensils. Staff very friendly and helpful. Close to restaurants and the Food Pantry where you could stock up on groceries for self cater. Close to bus stop also. Basically a good location for a reasonable cost in the middle of Waikiki. The $20 per day amenities charge was the only downside but I think most places have this.

First, nice but older room with a nice view. Website is misleading as it says free Wi-Fi but in fact you have to pay for it as part of 18 dollar per day resort fee. Other things you get for resort fee / phone, paper, safe are not worth 18 dollars. Beware for misleading web info. Had to pay 414 resort fee after check. Here until Dec. - hope manager rectifies this.

We stayed here for almost 2 weeks. The hotel is the place where local residents stay. The staff is nice, helpful and accommodating. The Ilima is not a fancy resort; however, the rooms are large and comfortable. They have kitchenettes which includes pots, pans and utensils. The hotel has a small swimming pool. The hotel is located in the center of Waikiki and about 10 minutes walk to the beach. Perfect place to stay for a short or long visit.
